revised_title: Obituary of Sir Alfred Bray Kempe: Mathematician and Ecclesiastical Lawyer
tldr: This obituary honors Sir Alfred Bray Kempe, a distinguished mathematician and lawyer who served as the Treasurer and Vice-President of the Royal Society for 21 years. Kempe made significant contributions to the field of mathematics, particularly in kinematics, and was a leading authority on ecclesiastical law. He held several chancellorships of dioceses and played a crucial role in the protection of church fabrics.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Biography and Autobiography
